mdRecord.dcterms:title: Traitor, spare that flag / by the Rev. J.P. Lundy. ; Air--"Woodman spare that tree."
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lundy, John P. (John Patterson), 1823-1892
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Ten illustrated songs on notepaper, mailed to any address on receipt of 50 cts. Published byCharles Magnus, 12 Frankfort St. N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in four verses; without music. Printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line: Traitor, Spare that flag.

Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include Washington, in New York City directories for 1861 through 1867. D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864.

Hand-colored headpiece with a vignette of a seated woman and a man holding a flag with legend "The Union forever" on the left and the New York state seal on the right. Magnus 41a. Cf. American song sheets, 2361c.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Second of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
